TracingConfig.description: The function's AWS X-Ray tracing configuration. To sample and record incoming requests, set Mode to Active.

Mode.markdownDescription:
The tracing mode.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: Active | PassThrough  
Update requires: No interruption

TracingConfig.markdownDescription:
The function's AWS X-Ray tracing configuration. To sample and record incoming requests, set Mode to Active.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

VpcConfig.description: The VPC security groups and subnets that are attached to a Lambda function. When you connect a function to a VPC, Lambda creates an elastic network interface for each combination of security group and subnet in the function's VPC configuration. The function can only access resources and the internet through that VPC.

Ipv6AllowedForDualStack.description: A boolean indicating whether IPv6 protocols will be allowed for dual stack subnets
Ipv6AllowedForDualStack.markdownDescription:
A boolean indicating whether IPv6 protocols will be allowed for dual stack subnets

---

Required: No  
Type: Boolean  
Update requires: No interruption

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list of VPC security groups IDs.

Update requires: No interruption

SubnetIds.markdownDescription:

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

VpcConfig.markdownDescription:
The VPC security groups and subnets that are attached to a Lambda function. When you connect a function to a VPC, Lambda creates an elastic network interface for each combination of security group and subnet in the function's VPC configuration. The function can only access resources and the internet through that VPC.

Update requires: No interruption

SnapStart.description: The function's SnapStart setting. When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

ApplyOn.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.
ApplyOn.markdownDescription:
Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: PublishedVersions | None  
Update requires: No interruption

SnapStart.markdownDescription:
The function's SnapStart setting. When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

SnapStartResponse.description: The function's SnapStart Response. When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

OptimizationStatus.description: Indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.
OptimizationStatus.markdownDescription:
Indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: On | Off  
Update requires: No interruption

ApplyOn.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

S3ObjectVersion.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use.
S3ObjectVersion.markdownDescription:
For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use.

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 1024  
Update requires: No interruption

S3Bucket.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.
S3Bucket.markdownDescription:
An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 3  
Maximum Length: 63  
Pattern: ^[0-9A-Za-z\.\-_]*(?<!\.)$  
Update requires: No interruption

ZipFile.description: The source code of your Lambda function. If you include your function source inline with this parameter, AWS CloudFormation places it in a file named index and zips it to create a deployment package..
ZipFile.markdownDescription:
The source code of your Lambda function. If you include your function source inline with this parameter, AWS CloudFormation places it in a file named index and zips it to create a deployment package..

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

S3Key.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.
S3Key.markdownDescription:
The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

Update requires: No interruption

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.
Arn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 200  
Pattern: ^arn:aws[a-zA-Z-]*:elasticfilesystem:[a-z]{2}((-gov)|(-iso(b?)))?-[a-z]+-\d{1}:\d{12}:access-point/fsap-[a-f0-9]{17}$  
Update requires: No interruption

LocalMountPath.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.
LocalMountPath.markdownDescription:
The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 160  
Pattern: ^/mnt/[a-zA-Z0-9-_.]+$  
Update requires: No interruption

FileSystemConfig.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Value.markdownDescription:
The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Key.markdownDescription:
The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

FileSystemConfigs.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. To connect a function to a file system, a mount target must be available in every Availability Zone that your function connects to. If your template contains an AWS::EFS::MountTarget resource, you must also specify a DependsOn attribute to ensure that the mount target is created or updated before the function.
FileSystemConfigs.markdownDescription:
Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. To connect a function to a file system, a mount target must be available in every Availability Zone that your function connects to. If your template contains an AWS::EFS::MountTarget resource, you must also specify a DependsOn attribute to ensure that the mount target is created or updated before the function.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function, up to 64 characters in length. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates one.
FunctionName.markdownDescription:
The name of the Lambda function, up to 64 characters in length. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates one.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Update requires: Replacement

Runtime.description: The identifier of the function's runtime.
Runtime.markdownDescription:
The identifier of the function's runtime.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

KmsKeyArn.description: The ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that's used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If it's not provided, AWS Lambda uses a default service key.
KmsKeyArn.markdownDescription:
The ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that's used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If it's not provided, AWS Lambda uses a default service key.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws[a-zA-Z-]*)?:[a-z0-9-.]+:.*)|()$  
Update requires: No interruption

PackageType.markdownDescription:
PackageType.

Required: No  
Type: String

Update requires: No interruption

A unique Arn for CodeSigningConfig resource

Type: String

Update requires: No interruption

Layers.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version.

MemorySize.description: The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function's memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.
MemorySize.markdownDescription:
The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function's memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.

---

Required: No  
Type: Integer  
Update requires: No interruption

DeadLetterConfig.description: A dead letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing.
DeadLetterConfig.markdownDescription:
A dead letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing.

---

Required: No  
Type:   
Update requires: No interruption

Timeout.description: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.
Timeout.markdownDescription:
The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.

---

Required: No  
Type: Integer  
Update requires: No interruption

Handler.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function. The format includes the file name. It can also include namespaces and other qualifiers, depending on the runtime
Handler.markdownDescription:
The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function. The format includes the file name. It can also include namespaces and other qualifiers, depending on the runtime

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 128  
Pattern: ^[^\s]+$  
Update requires: No interruption

Update requires: No interruption

Role.markdownDescription:

Required: Yes
